case.state: Well, my official title is High Summoner of the Eternal Calm, but just Yuna is fine! Your outfit is lovely as well, by the way!
It's a pleasure to meet you. My name is Yuna, and I would love to share in your story.
W-why are there two of Weiss?
Is one of the Yangs a fayth?
Oh, there are people with teleportation magic here?
Oh, hello again Fina. I've been extremely busy with all of my duties, so this is a welcome break.
Oh my, were some people tricked into playing strip poker? That's terrible!
That's...actually a good question, Misty.
Hmmm, I thought about skinny dipping at Besaid once but I was too afraid to get caught. There was a lake this one time though...
W-w-wait! You can't show this to anyone! People in Spira might see!
Oh, can you not remember your name? Sin's toxin can cause amnesia.
Well, I get a lot of physical activity in combat, and the physical requirements of performing summoning rituals helped me learn to keep in fighting shape early on in life.
Is that butterfly an aeon?
Hmm, you seem awfully familiar for some reason, Tifa.
Oh, your name is Yuna too? What a coincidence!
Oh, is your first language Al Bhed by any chance, Petra?
Is that an aeon over there?
Oh, well summoners usually do the recruting instead of the other way around.
Wait, an unsent is playing?!
Oh, I've never met anyone with eyes like mine before!
It's nice to see another practitioner of magic here!
Oh my, are you some kind of machina? I...don't really have experience with them because I was banned from using them by the Church of Yevon.
Oh, I was told there would be more people here.
Hi, I'm Yuna, High Summoner of Spira, but please treat me like you would anyone else. My cousin Rikku told me this was a fun place to relax.
Can I get ~cards~ cards, please?
Hmm, how many should I trade?
I think I'll take ~cards~, Dealer.
How many cards should I trade?
I could really use some good cards.
Don't think about if these cards are bad.
It appears beginner's luck is on my side.
I've never really played poker before, but I think this is good.
I am afraid one of you will be losing this time.
Compared to fighting fiends, strip poker is a breeze!
Having the luxury to relax and play games makes me feel alive. After so many years surrounded by death, it is a blessing.
Just so we are clear, my talent for magic doesn't extend to any sort of trickery.
This is a relief. I came here to let loose, but I'm not quite ready to take off any more just yet.
Looks like I can win even without Guardians here to protect me!
I think I'm starting to get the hang of this!
Someone out there must be looking out for me!
This hand couldn't have come before now?
I might have a chance to win this yet!
Just a warning-high summoners don't give up very easily.
I may be willing to pay the forfeit, but I don't plan to go down easily!
Well, I suppose the game wouldn't be much fun if you knew how each hand would turn out.
I suppose sometimes you have to make a leap of faith.
I still have a lot left to lose so a mediocre hand isn't the end of the world.
I guess risk is just a part of the game.
Not knowing if your hand is good is a lot less fun the less clothes you have on.
I guess I did want some excitement back in my life when I came here.
Nothing to do but wait and see how the cards fall.
I never really got to do anything like this when I was growing up on Besaid. My friends were very overprotective after I lost my father.
At least I'm not guaranteed to lose this round.
I really wish this hand was more of a sure thing given what's at stake.
It's hard to focus on the cards when you're all looking at me.
Well, it's good to know no one is rigging the deck for me. I hate getting special treatment because I'm famous.
This game is harder than it sounded when Rikku told me about it.
I guess it's a good thing I brought a lot of items with me today!
The people of Spira would be shocked if they knew I was doing this.
Ser Jecht mentioned a game like this from his home once, but Ser Auron made him stop telling me the story.
My cousin, Brother, offered to come with me. I feel a little bad about turning him down, but he's been a little odd around me lately.
Well, that could have gone better. I'll just have to focus harder next time.
I should be upset about this hand, but a part of me is just happy to be here playing a game like this like a normal woman.
With these cards, it's time to start thinking about what I should take off next.
Well, I guess taking a bit more off wouldn't be so bad.
I just hope Kimahri doesn't find out about this. He'd probably tear this place to the ground.
Wait, can I try again?
B-b-but I can't lose now!
Well...I guess I'll be letting loose even more than I expected to.
I'm sorry. I don't think I've represented Spira very well today.
I gave my word as High Summoner, and I will pay the forfeit if I have to.
I suppose having one man is a bit odd.
No tan lines. Do you have to sunbathe...nude?
Happy Birthday, Meia. I'm honored you're spending it with us!
My life changed forever on a recent adventure. My guardians and I set out to defeat Sin and bring peace to the world. I never could have guessed how the journey would change my life.
I get the feeling your relationship with Chun-Li isn't quite as antagonistic as you let on, Juri.
My dreams have changed recently. I used to want save the world...now I just wish I could save one man.
Thank you for undoing the magic, Tharja.
I know healing magic as well. I can help you with any wounded, Fina.
Oh, is that your lover, Lyralei?
Not just similar-if my eyes were closed I'd think you were twins!
I really hope it's the drinks, but I'm pretty sure there's a worse explanation.
I've killed monsters, but I don't enjoy taking life like you Megumin.
I don't think I've ever tried one of those, Sakura. I'd love to get one with you after the game if you want!
Oh my! She sounds terrifying!
Before I traveled with Tidus and the others, I spent my whole life cloistered in the local temple so hearing stories of other places is enjoyable, Fina.
I never really tried to seduce men. They just seem to be interested in me. Well, Wakka and Lulu would say too interested.
I wonder if that's true on Spira as well. I've heard stories of creatures called antlions, and I'm very glad there aren't over a million of them.
I'd like to join you if you decide to dance. Dancing for happiness and not to console grieving families would be a relief.
I believe it's not the amount of time you have, but what you do with it that matters.
I won't let you attack innocents, Kyou!
It's a little nerve wracking to think about, but yes I'm willing to pay the forfeit. It's a good idea to make everyone else is too-thanks, Y'shtola!
Maybe machina are dangerous after all.
Thank you for the hospitality, Sei.
Oh, you're going to take off two things?
Well...maybe...if the right man were around.
Well, in my case I was determined not to fall in love because of my duties as a summoner. Fate had other ideas for my story.
My guardian Tidus liked to collect primers on the Al Bhed language.
There was a place called Zanarkand that fell into ruin long ago in my home of Spira...it was home to someone very dear to me.
Treasure hunting does sound like it would be fun!
I would say the fall of Zanarkand was a pretty important moment in Spira's history.
Ultima is a pretty cool spell.
Hmmm, there is the story of Zanarkand, but perhaps I'll tell you that later-it's a long tale.
I've never really done much shopping on my own. The temple provided me for when I was young, and now I tend to get swarmed at stores by people who know me.
I hear there's a lot of hard working volunteers who set everything up. They're always looking for more volunteers to help advertise to new players.
I have practiced laughing! HA HA HA HA HA! Why does everyone always mock my laugh?
I don't know if I have any magic words. All I can say is that if you love someone let them know before it's too late. I wish I'd confessed sooner than I did.
Well...there was one man who saw me naked one night at a lake once.
Honestly, I brought my staff with me because I'd feel naked without it...although I guess that's kind of the point of this game.
I was trained as a summoner to help defeat Sin and the sin eaters it produced. Recently, I've found myself in need of new magic skills though.
I'm most skilled with a staff, but I've been thinking about training with other weapons lately.
I never really thought about becoming a mother. There wasn't really an opportunity when training to become a High Summoner.
I'm glad I can inspire people, but being famous doesn't leave a lot of time for personal desires to be fulfilled. That's actually why I came here today.
A boar? Is that anything like a shoopuf?
I don't like when people make jokes about Sin. So many lives were lost to that monster.
Well, normally I'd be worried about an unsent but I do enjoy singing! How about the Monster Mash?
I've only had one relationship-it was short but it wasn't casual.
I think ~player~ was planning to finish playing with the rest of us. Sorry, Perona.
Well, I would say this is my favorite outfit. Once the dressphere is ready, I might start experimenting with some different looks though.
I've been really interested in singing and treasure hunting lately on the rare occasions I have free time.
A rival summoner named Dona was determined to outdo me during my pilgrimage.
Hmm, I suppose I tend to tell my story via internal monologue.
That sounds like my cousin Rikku! She's always quick to cheer me up.
I was named for Lady Yunalesca, the first Summoner to defeat Sin and bring about the Calm.
I prefer the heat as well, probably because I grew up on a tropical island.
No need to apologize, Aoba. I'm happy to listen to your story.
I don't really have the best history with the undead.
I don't have fur, but my guardian Kimahri does.
Well...my chest will never compare with Lulu's, so I guess butts?
I never had any biological siblings, but my former guardians Wakka and Lulu have been like big siblings to me since I was a child.
Maybe it's robots using magic?
I do enjoy music quite a bit. I'd love to hear about your culture's music, Sayaka.
I like your positive thinking, Nami. I am proud of my legs...maybe I should get an outfit that shows them off more.
I don't think hacking at our cards with a sword would help you win...is this some sort of machina thing I don't know about?
An honorable person would have told the truth from the start, Hilda.
Aren't there rules against cheating at the Inventory? Using a magic portal seems like it would break at least one rule.
I think taking a break from our normal responsibilities is a good thing, May.
That would depend on the dungeon...I wouldn't want to go through the sewers again clothed, much less naked.
I just assumed you were an adult, Aoba, given what kind of place this is.
I played a practice round with my cousin, Rikku before the game-minus the stripping, of course!
I like to think I value all of my friends equally...but there was one who became, um, more.
Are golems like machina?
If you heard anything about me performing a concert, it may have been a case of mistaken identity.
I guess I would tell my younger self to value every moment she got to spent with her father.
There are tests to become an assassin?!
That's terrible. I would never bully you, Ignatz.
I'd like to visit your gallery someday. One of my favorite parts of the pilgrimage was seeing all of the sights Spira has to offer.
Well, I've heard rumors of strip blitzball but I don't know if they're true or not.
I understand ending up with enemies for doing the right thing. A certain corrupt maester comes to mind.
I would say yes, but the way you say anything is concerning.
That's very courteous of you, Arash.
Uh, I hope this isn't rude, but I noticed you're transparent. Are you an unsent? It's just usually the undead in my world maintain their physical bodies.
My world is called Spira. For many years we were attacked by the fiend known as Sin, but we have recently entered an Eternal Calm.
Well, I haven't seen it, but I have heard it. Our ship isn't very large and people get...lonely. Not naming who it was though!
Hmm, until recently I would have said I'm an excellent summoner. I guess I need something new...I have been thinking about taking up guns.
I can perform a sending for those ghosts!
I'd be happy to take a meal with you!
My greatest fear used to be not living up to my father's legacy as High Summoner.
I haven't had good experiences with deities.
Well there's always a first time to succeed if you persevere, Joey.
Guardians work with their summoner sort of like mercenaries, so I suppose the truly great guardians have a cause they believe in.
Unfortunately, my life has seen far too many people cruelly separated.
I'm quite familiar with HP! Let me know if you need some restored!
Oh, I guess it has nothing to do with that Gilgamesh, then.
I'm sorry Streaming-Chan, but I'm rather happy no one outside this room is watching us.
I used to worry about divine punishment from Yevon. I can't believe how foolish I was.
If there are any demons here, I'm quite experienced in fighting them!
I'm proud to say I put my life on the line against Sin!
H-how did you survive being eaten by a giant frog?!
My favorite view is my home island of Besaid from the shore.
Actually, I just started as a novice treasure hunter myself with a group called the Gullwings.
I can't control how you use your powers, Ibuki, but I will say using your abilities to help others is an amazing feeling.
That's an, um, interesting strategy, Mary.
Oh, did your church tell you that?
Calls for donations remind me of this merchant...O'aka I think his name was?
I suppose losing my parents as a child was the worst luck I've had. My whole world was overturned, but my friends saved me.
I'm not really sure what endorsements are, but I do understand smiling for public appearances even when you don't want to.
Y'shtola, what made you interested in black magic? I've mostly used my magic for healing and summoning, but I would like to pick up some offensive spells to help my friends.
Does your tattoo have a meaning, Y'shtola?
Hmm, I'm not sure I've seen anyone of your species before, Y'shtola. Are there any humans or ronso in your world?
Do you know any mages who use summoning magic, Y'shtola?
I've been struggling to deal with replacing some of my lost magic skills recently-do you have any tips on taking up a new path, Y'shtola?
How does Eorzea feel about the use of machina, Y'shtola? Sometimes I still struggle with using it since the church banned its use long before I was born.
I can see how that might get confusing. My cousin Rikku likes to call me Yunie, if you need a nickname for me.
Well, I was trained by the temple to defeat a monster named Sin and bring the Calm to the land, but in recent days I've struck out on my own path.
Well, my father died bringing about the Calm when I was very young so I was raised at the Temple on Besaid. I suppose part of the reason I chose to train as a summoner was to be closer to him.
Well, to be honest recently I've become more of a treasure hunter than a summoner. I get the feeling you might approve of that change.
I didn't realize it was that obvious, Fina. Indeed, from youth I was raised to become a summoner and defeat Sin. In the end though, my story had an unexpected outcome.
Yes, summoners are close with spirits we call the fayth. Summoners would go on pilgrimage to the temples to gather fayth to call upon in battle.
These robes were given to me while I was raised at a Temple in the Church of Yevon actually. I was never a maester though.
Well, my cousin has been suggesting I ditch the traditional outfit for something more like your outfit, Nami.
I guess hearing the rules of poker from Rikku didn't prepare me for actually playing it.
Well, there goes my winning streak.
It's true it wouldn't be the full Inventory experience if I didn't lose at least once.
Well, I suppose I can take something big off since I appear to be winning at the moment.
I'm going to count my sleeves as a separate item. I hope that's not against the rules.
I won't back down. A summoner always honors her word.
Okay, time to focus. I can't lose again!
At least being in the lead makes this a little bit easier.
S-so we're all going to be...naked. Okay, I'll do it-Rikku will never stop teasing me if I run away now!
I enjoy wading barefoot in the water near my island, so this is actually more comfortable for me.
Since I only took off my sleeves last time, I believe I owe you all a bigger prize this time.
Would it be alright if I just took off my sleeves? I don't want to break any rules.
The old maesters in the church of Yevon would have had a heart attack if they saw me doing this.
I really wish Shinra would have had those dresspheres ready to use before I came here.
Just a warning-if you decide to tell anyone I did this, my guardians can be very overprotective.
C-could you all look away for just a moment? I need to gather my courage.
Oh, uh, I-I have to go first, then?
Okay, I think I've worked up enough courage to take something bigger off now.
I hope you won't mind if I just take my sleeves off. I need all the items I can get right now.
I guess being a natural at poker was too much to hope for.
Please, no jokes about me not being able to summon more clothing.
A-are you sure I really have to...expose myself?
I wanted a break from all the rules back home, but maybe this is taking it a bit too far.
I enjoy wading barefoot in the water near my island so this is actually more comfortable for me.
I'll start with my boots. I remove them when I perform sendings for the souls of the dead anyways.
Time to be brave, and take something bigger off.
Thank you for letting me count my sleeves as an item. I promise I'll work up the courage to take something bigger off if I lose again.
This obi is a bit hard to tie, honestly. I've been considering wearing something more casual recently.
People from Besaid don't give up easily. Our local blitzball team lost dozens of times but they kept going until they finally won the tournament!
P-please don't look. I've never done anything like this before.
I can't believe I lost everything, but it is my duty to honor my bets.
Please don't stare. It's hard enough being the first one exposed.
Oh... you might not be familiar with Sending. It's the job of a summoner to banish the souls of the departed to the farplane, lest they transform into monsters and attack people.
Maybe I should have taken my boots off before we started. It is good manners after all.
I don't think I truly realized how embarrassing this would be until now.
I do feel a little guilty about counting my sleeves as an item.
Here's hoping I can make a comeback like the Besaid Aurochs did!
I-if I lose again, I'll have to...oh dear.
I can't believe I just exposed myself to strangers. What am I doing?
I wanted to cast aside the trappings of the Church of Yevon, but I didn't expect to cast aside all of my clothing too.
Oh, I'm sorry. I thought you were mute!
I was pretty sheltered growing up since my father was the late High Summoner so I never really played games like this with the boys on the island.
I might not look like it, but I did learn about battle tactics when I trained to become a Summoner.
I'm used to meeting with strangers as High Summoner, but this is certainly a first for me.
I noticed you were staring at me instead of your cards last round, ~name~. Is something wrong?
Are you sure you're okay with me watching this? I could turn around if you like.
I am grateful to you for allowing me to keep what clothes I have left on.
Watching this is even more embarrassing than it was when I was dressed.
I'm just grateful I didn't lose again.
W-w-why are you staring at me while you take off your ~clothing~?
I think this is the least you could do for me given the circumstances.
Compared to this, taking something off should be easy for you.
I can't believe I'm touching myself in public while a man strips in front of me. If anyone ever found out...
Could you hurry it up? It's a bit cold here.
I can't believe you still had clothes left after I finished the forfeit.
Maybe you could teach me to play poker better after the game?
It just seem odd that a summoner would need a whip, Lucy.
I never expected that kind of language from Aoba!
Who's Maurice?
Oh my! What a strange aeon!
Ever since I lost my aeons, I've been thinking about picking some new combat skills. Do you think you could teach me how to use pistols, Aimee?
When you can use magic, parlor tricks tend to lose their appeal.
You might need to practice your magic more, Joey.
I wanted to learn how to use guns, but this wasn't what I had in mind!
Don't worry, I won't tell anyone about your picture. I think it's kind of sweet that you carry it with you.
Now that she's running out of puns, there might be light at the end of the tunnel.
I...I think I might be sick.
I try not to judge people, but this Chat person seems to be very vulgar.
They wouldn't be secret if I told you, would they?
I heard there are a lot more women who come to play at the Inventory than men. I wonder why?
My apologies for taking your clothes, but I must uphold my honor by giving my all to this game.
Have no fear. I won't think any less of you for losing. Honoring your wager speaks highly of your character.
Now this is something I didn't see growing up in the Temple.
I've seen Lulu and Rikku change before but that was under very different circumstances.
I hope we can be friendly after this. Some summoners enjoy lording their position over others, but I'm not one of them.
It's nice to play with someone who doesn't treat me any differently because of my famous father or because of my role as High Summoner.
Thanks! I owe you one for keeping me in the game!
Could you maybe take something big off so people will stop staring at me?
I haven't given up on winning just yet!
Believe me, doing this in public is worse than losing your ~clothing~.
If it helps, I think I'm the center of attention instead of you at the moment.
I have a feeling a lot of men back in Spira would kill to see this situation.
If you'd told me I'd be watching this back when I finished Summoner training I would have thought you were crazy.
Would you like me to try a calming spell to help you?
This game has been fun, but right now I really just want to get dressed again.
Having another woman here reminds me of being back home with the Gullwings.
I-is that machina dangerous?!
Is that some kind of sun aeon?
It appears this journey is only just beginning.
The men from my home tend not to wear many accessories since it's a pretty tropical place.
Would you mind if I performed a blessing for this game?
You're certainly a challenging opponent, ~name~.
I thought I'd brought plenty of clothing, but perhaps I should have brought more.
Just be glad my cousin Rikku isn't here. She has a tendency to steal valuable items.
I exposed myself and you only take your ~clothing~ off?!
Just when I thought this couldn't get any more humiliating.
I guess I really do have a lot left to learn.
That feels like it goes against the spirit of the game...and of hygiene.
Well, I would certainly hope you wouldn't hack at us with a sword, 9S.
This journey may be hard, but we have lots of time.
Are you feeling as nervous about this as I am?
Growing up, most men were afraid to approach me because my father was famous. It's nice to be treated like a normal woman for once.
I'd better focus if I want to catch up to you.
Maybe I should have counted my necklace.
You were certainly prepared for this, ~name~.
I was tired of constantly being treated like a hero, but this is a little too much disrespect.
I don't think I'll be able to summon my dignity back after this.
You are really tempting me to use one of the black magic spells Lulu taught me.
My white magic should be able to fix that!
Oh my, I didn't know it was possible to get permanently banned!
Oh, I guess this was just too much for poor Florina.
Maybe I should start trying to counteract this spell.
Oh, this aeon has a human form too!
If you love this Hank, you should tell him. I'd give anything to talk to the man I love one more time.
Oh no, your staff! Don't worry, after the game we can go and try to find you a replacement together.
If that's a magical girl outfit, Sayaka, does that mean my clothes are as well since I'm a summoner?
Oh, I thought your cape just had some sort of special value to you.
Um, Misato, you might want to keep your legs together...for um, reasons.
Galatea, it doesn't matter if you're an animate. The true value of a person has nothing to do with whether they're human, ronso, fayth, or anything else.
If you had that, why didn't you take it off earlier?!
I don't mind if you want to start with small things.
It looks like we'll be here awhile. I hope we can become friends while we play.
Do you usually wear accessories like that or is it just for this game?
Any chance you could take something bigger off next time since I took off my hakama?
I learned how to play poker from the Al Bhed side of my family, but we never played for clothes.
I have faith we'll be even soon enough!
How are you so good at this?!
I know I'm a beginner, but I didn't think I would lose THIS badly.
I was really hoping you'd take something bigger off so everyone would stop staring at me.
Oh my! Should we call the authorities to report Nami?
Y'shtola, could you teach me to glamour clothing? It might come in handy some day.
Well that's certainly more of Lucy than I was expecting to see this round.
Maybe without her knife, I can perform a sending and put Spooky's soul at rest.
That's very courteous of you to honor the spirit of the game by taking a bigger item off, Sola.
If that counts, I guess I could count my staff as an item, but I'd feel weird without it.
Just so you know, I'm playing to relieve the stress of being the High Summoner. I don't enjoy embarrassing others.
Playing a game like this without a care in the world is something I never thought I would get to do as a Summoner.
If I keep winning, you're bound to run out of accessories eventually.
I hope my father wouldn't have been disappointed in me for playing a game like this.
I've been thinking about changing up my style lately. Your accessories are cute-have any suggestions?
Let's just move on before I do anything I'd regret.
The last person who annoyed me this much was an undead.
I feel like I've let everyone down by playing this poorly.
Did he just, uh, bite you?
I never really had a chance to play games like this with the boys back on the island. My guardians were quite protective of me.
Oh, no reason to be embarrassed if that's what you're taking off.
To be honest, most of the men in Spira would be too nervous to play a game like this with me because of my reputation.
It's not a big win, but I should be grateful nonetheless.
I guess poker requires practice to learn, just like summoning.
Now if I can just do that again next round, I'll be set.
Maybe you could take something bigger off out of pity?
Seeing you take off something like your ~clothing~ just makes me feel even more embarrassed about this.
Well, this could have gone better.
Oh, let me see if I can help find your glasses, Ignatz.
I guess I just never let loose because I was always so focused on my duty to Spira.
Sorry, I'm just a little flustered by this.
I think I'm doing well for a first timer. Hopefully my luck holds out.
I was feeling a little embarrassed after I lost my hakama, but this is cheering me up.
After a lifetime devoted to the Church of Yevon, it's still a little hard to feel comfortable doing this.
Maybe a bit of magic will calm my nerves for the next round.
This is not how I planned on this game going.
You look like you're enjoying this more than I am, ~name~.
I remember when I had small things like that still.
Lyn, I don't think we should make Florina play if she doesn't want to.
Hold still, Florina! I can take care of the bee!
I've heard legends of people being turned into toads with magic, but not into monkeys!
EEK! Your head!
Well, I guess there's probably more unlikely love stories out there. I have a pair of friends who were always bickering until they fell in love.
I'm so sorry there wasn't a summoner to perform a sending for you. I can perform the ritual to put your soul at peace, Sakura.
How did you learn to dance? The sending ritual requires intricate movement of the body so studying other dances would be interesting.
How long will it take your wool to grow back, Leggy?
I can't say I do...
Do you always need to help to take your boots off? That doesn't seem very practical.
Taking all of your armor off at once seems like a decision you might regret.
Uh, is there a reason you have to finish the game quickly?
I'm a little sorry to see you lose. Your ~clothing~ looks cute on you.
I've traveled all over Spira, and this may still be the strangest place I've visited.
I wonder if Lulu would have counted her stuffed moogle as an item?
Could I ask you for suggestions on my wardrobe after the game?
Sometimes it still amazes me that the world is at peace, and I can do things like this instead of focusing on my pilgrimage.
I admit the stakes being raised does make this game more exciting than regular poker.
This is worse than the time I got dumped into a sewer.
I think I had a nightmare like this once.
I really hope Rikku keeps her promise not to mention I came here to the others.
Sayaka, look out! There's some sort of malevolent entity behind you!
That's terrible that they'd make you pay for a replacement.
Oh, I guess I should have worn socks today.
Time to see where the cards will lead us.
I'm more of a blitzball fan than a card player. Someone very special to me used to play it.
The atmosphere in here could use some music. I've been told I have a good singing voice.
I have to admit this isn't a chapter I would have expected in my story.
I'm still in this and that's all I can ask for!
There's no way for news about this game to leave the Inventory, is there?
I can't believe you still had that!
Is there a beginner's version I could play next time?
Not my finest moment.
Someone else has dressphere technology? But Shinra said they weren't ready yet.
Is there anything I can do to make this easier for you?
You're already taking off your ~clothing~?!
Well, Rikku did say this would take my mind off of my troubles.
I might have a shot at winning this!
Are you sure you couldn't take off something smaller?
Some female summoners tend to choose their guardians based on their bodies, b-but I'm not like them!
This would have been more helpful before I lost my clothes.
I won't look at you so please don't stare at me while you take off your ~clothing~.
I-I'm sorry I looked, I'm just nervous, and I've never done this, and...um, sorry!
I can't believe I might actually win my first time playing!
It won't restore your clothing, but maybe my magic can at least improve your health?
Well then, I'll just be staring at my cards for the rest of the game.
I kind of wish I could have played this game with someone I used to know.
This isn't a dream, is it?
It's amazing how I can still feel naive after all the things I've seen.
Is this easier in your culture? Because in Spira this is very embarrassing.
You're taking that off, when I'm...oh dear.
I probably shouldn't tell Kimahri about this...he once attacked a man just for talking to me too much.
There's someone whose face I'd like to see again too.
Lucy, a summoner should know better than to use her aeons to cheat at games!
Oh, are we not allowed to count our shoes in this game?
Are you sure there isn't some sort of rule about this?
AH! Look out!
Um, does anyone here know how to sew? Erufuda might need an emergency tailor job.
Oh, I-I was expecting things to move more slowly.
Should we tell her?
Is there anything I can do to ease your burden?
I feel badly for you, but it would be against the rules to throw hands to help you out.
I've heard of beginner's luck, but this is incredible!
I wonder if Lulu would get to count each of her belts as an item? We'd never beat her.
Maybe some magic will help calm you.
It's hard to believe we just met at the start of this game given how much we've shared with each other.
It looks like our stories today won't be happy ones.
I wonder if it would be possible to perform a sending for our dignity.
Someone else being in a similar situation to mine is actually helping a bit.
I wonder if I should practice transforming for when the Dresspheres are ready?
There's no need to be embarrassed about your scar, Misato. One of my guardians, Sir Auron, had scars and he was one of the bravest men I've ever met.
Your uniform has mandatory underwear, Bernadetta? That's something not even the Church of Yevon required of us.
I thought about hiding my identity when I came here because I'm a well known figure back home, but I wanted to just be a regular woman for once.
Oh, is this your true form? It's a pleasure to meet you for real.
Uh, won't you need your clothes for the journey home, Aimee?
Gym...class? We didn't have that at the Temple where I was educated.
There's this hot springs on Mount Gagazet I've heard of. Maybe we should visit sometime since we've already seen each other undressed here.
I hope if I lose, I can work up the nerve to do what you just did.
I promise none of my magic can affect the outcome of the game.
If I win, do I get some sort of trophy to take home?
It appears one of us will be walking the path of defeat soon.
I wonder if there are places like this hidden in Spira. I traveled the world, but I only stopped at the temples of Yevon and the blitzball stadium in Luca.
I enjoy winning, but on the other hand, I hate causing anyone suffering.
Well, on the bright side it shouldn't be much longer until the game ends and we get our clothes back.
At least I'm not the only woman feeling let down tonight.
I can't believe we're doing this in public!
Oh, I've heard of magnet magic!
I don't intend to run from my duty, but it is slightly troubling that we're trapped in here.
Stand back! He might need healing!
My favorite sport is played underwater so seeing a shirtless man won't distract me from the game.
My home in Besaid is a tropical island so it isn't uncommon for the men to go shirtless there.
At least you wore a shirt. Our airship's pilot, Brother, seems to think overall straps count as a shirt.
I've seen plenty of shirtless men back home, but I was never exposed in front of them.
Trust me, being shirtless is MUCH worse for me than it will be for you.
I hadn't anticipated taking my shirt off before you did.
Oh...oh my.
My friends said I needed to move on...I guess this is one way.
Taking your shirt off would have been more useful when I was paying the forfeit.
I showed you everything and you haven't even taken your shirt off yet. I might actually die of embarrassment.
Wait, ~player~ is in charge of this place?!
Oh, do you play sports? You look like you'd be a good blitzball player.
This actually reminds me of my father's guardian Sir Jecht. His refusal to put a shirt on always used to irritate the local priest.
One of my best friends, Wakka, used to go shirtless all the time, but since he retired from blitzball he's gotten a bit chubby.
Don't expect me to lose my focus just because you took your shirt off, ~name~.
I've seen plenty of shirtless men back home, but I was never exposed in front of them.
Just so you know I'm not the kind of girl who goes topless first normally!
I-I was only staring because you stared at my chest first!
I suppose I should thank you for easing my burden.
I-I'm certainly not thinking of you, ~name~!
The only reason I'm glad you took your shirt off is it means I get my clothes back sooner.
After what I just did, I don't think anything can embarrass me now.
I'd recommend the hat.
That's what you get for cheating!
I would have preferred to beat you through my own effort.
What?! You're going to...expose yourself? I'm not ready!
If you were trying to lose, you should be ashamed of yourself!
Don't you have anything else left to take off?
I'm not sure how I feel about you stripping naked while I'm without my hakama.
I know this is part of the game and Rikku said I should give other men a chance, but it still feels weird to do this.
If you try anything while you're naked, I have magic at my disposal. Just so we're clear.
If I have to expose myself then so do you.
Could we make a deal not to look at each other.
I'm supposed to whistle if I get into trouble, but I think that would have the opposite effect here.
Well, um, I guess I wouldn't say no to you stripping again.
It's pretty difficult to do this with people watching so maybe I do need help to do this.
I hope you don't have to go through what I did.
Actually, it isn't so embarrassing to see this after paying the forfeit in front of all of you.
Oh, um, this doesn't really match what the older girls on the island told me about men.
Is there anything I can do to help ease your shame? Um, nothing perverted, though!
D-do some people enjoy humiliation?
I almost feel bad for beating you now.
Unfortunately, I don't know any spells that can help with that.
I was getting nervous, but that's actually not a big deal! Oh, sorry.
I'm really starting to regret playing this game.
Well, I guess we're both humiliated now.
In the old days, I would have wondered if you had offended Yevon.
If you give your word, you should honor your commitment, Arash.
I'm not very fond of people who don't try their hardest, Arash.
Am I this good at poker, or were you trying to lose?
I'm guessing you thought I would be easier to defeat.
I'm so sorry-I think I looked by mistake! Please forgive me!
I guess this is a good reminder to be grateful for the clothes I have left.
I'm sorry about this, but I don't plan to lose!
Could you maybe not look at me next round? It's hard to focus when you're...you know.
Sorry, had the urge to purify the area suddenly.
It looks like neither of our stories will have a happy ending.
You really did it...
If you thought you'd impress me by showing me that right away, it's not working.
Were you intentionally trying to lose?
Oh, I guess that explains why you weren't worried about losing.
Focus on your cards, Yuna.
If it makes you feel any better, you have nothing to be ashamed of.
Oh my!
I wonder if Tidus was like ~name~.
I was starting to regret coming here, but I suppose this makes things a little better.
You're not part Ronso, are you?!
Uh, isn't the point of the game to try and stay covered?
Well, I suppose that's one way to pay up for losing the last round.
W-what? But I didn't perform a sending!
I feel a little bad seeing how embarrassed Y'shtola is right now.
Ah, I see you've been on the Wakka diet.
Don't worry, I can perform a sending to make sure her spirit goes where it belongs!
Oh, you're really going to show us your chest?
I hope you can forgive me for this. I didn't intend to embarrass you.
Don't worry. If anyone tries anything funny, I'll back you up with my magic.
Having someone join you makes even the hardest journey easier.
Maybe now everyone will stop staring at my chest.
As embarrassing as it may be, we have a duty to keep our word.
Well at your size, I'm sure a bra isn't necessary so don't be upset, Megumin.
Sorry, it's hard not to look! I didn't mean to.
I suppose that is one advantage of having long hair.
The heart matters more than the body if that makes you feel any better.
At least if I lose, I won't have to worry about being inadequate.
Sorry, but I don't think I know any spells that could help you with your size.
Well, I guess everyone is going to keep staring at my chest.
It's good to know I measure up to the competition.
I'm sure it took a lot of courage for you to go topless.
Juri, do you need healing?!
I saw someone very dear to me fade away once. I don't find that joke very funny.
Hmm, my cousin's ship's name is the Celsius, and my uncle's ship is named the Fahrenheit. I wonder if that means there's a Kelvin too.
Um, what is hen...tai?
Oh, we're about the same size! Maybe we could try trading outfits sometime.
I really hope I don't have to join you before this is over.
Is that really what I'll look like if I lose?
Don't worry, we're in this together ~name~.
It's nice to not be the only one exposed here.
After doing this together, we have to be friends!
Let me see if my white magic can counteract Tharja's. ESUNA!
I have to win now, because there's no way I can compare to that.
~Name~ reminds me of a friend of mine named Lulu.
Well, if I do lose no one's going to be staring at me, at least.
And this just got even more humiliating.
I know some healing magic, if you, um, need some help with the uh, back pain.
Well, at least no one will stare at me for the rest of the game now.
I think I can counteract that if you're okay with me treating your crew member, Meia.
Oh my! I-I don't think any of my magic can fix that.
I have to admit you fooled me that time, Joey.
On second thought, maybe I'm not ready to learn how advanced gun play!
I wonder why so few people ever turn around here.
That doesn't seem like something an adult should have to write a note to remind themselves of.
You're really going to take off your ~clothing~?!
I won't look! Unless that makes it more awkward, or um, sorry I'm making this worse for you aren't I?
If there's anything I can do to make this easier for you ~name~, I'll do it!
Don't worry ~name~, I won't think any less of you for losing your ~clothing~.
I'm honored you trust me enough to do this in front of me, ~name~.
It'll be nice not to be the only exposed here!
Jura, I know you're angry, but please calm down! We'll make Tharja fix this!
H-how would they be fake? Is that something machina can do?
Please, stop! There's no need for violence!
Stand back, I'll use my magic to protect us if necessary!
You have nothing to be ashamed of, Florina, but I don't mind you turning around if it makes you feel better.
Stand still, Aimee! I know healing magic!
It's okay to admit you just didn't wear any panties because of the kind of game this is.
Oh, I certainly didn't expect you to take your bottoms off first.
Oh, you don't have any hair. I hope I haven't violated the etiquette here by not shaving.
Wh-wh-what?! You're already exposing yourself?!
I'm not sure if I'm brave enough to do that.
I wanted a break from my responsibilities, but maybe I'm in over my head.
Now that I've seen what'll happen if I lose, it's going to be even harder to focus on the game.
Well, I did say I wanted to set aside the trappings of being the High Summoner...guess I might be doing it literally soon.
Well, if doing this together doesn't make us friends, nothing will.
You promise you won't tell anyone we did this, right?
I hope I'm okay compared to ~name~.
You have a cute face, Mika. You should unmask more often!
I do know some light magic...er, white magic.
I know this will be difficult for you, but let me know if I can ease the burden for you.
Please believe me, my magic can't affect the cards! You just have awful luck!
Oh my! That certainly wasn't one of the magic spells they taught me at the temple.
Oh, do you work for a nobleman? I knew a man named Trommell who served as a servant to the leader of the Guado.
Oh, I'm sorry to see Fate go, but no one should be forced to play.
Hmm, I was expecting something else. I guess I shouldn't judge a book by its cover.
Well, you don't compare to blitzball players.
I had no idea you were a woman, Lucina! You're quite talented at disguise!
Wait, are you an unsent? I could send you to the Farplane to rest if you would like, Arash.
I think you have plenty to be confident about, Mika. Mask or no mask.
It would seem your pride distracted you from the game, ~name~.
It was very brave of you to go first, ~name~. I hope I can be so courageous if the time comes.
Oh no! Chihiro is trapped in that machina!
Oh, I never would have guessed!
Thank you, Lyralei. That makes this easier.
Well, I suppose that isn't technically cheating, but it doesn't seem to be in the spirit of the game, Hilda.
Well, my cousin Rikku pointed out how stressed I've been lately. Doing something a little wild to relax where no one knows me or expects anything seemed like it would be refreshing so I came.
Do you think Jason needs healing magic?
I might win this!
I won but letting ~name~ do this while looking at me feels like a loss.
I'm sorry ~name~, but you have a duty to keep your word.
Please don't look at me while you touch your...you know.
I'm sorry, but I don't want to lose!
I'm not sure whether to be offended or complimented that you're already...excited.
Wait, we have to do this together?!
I-I'm only doing this with you because I gave my word to do this if I lost!
Alright, fine you can look at me if I can look at you. Just so that we can finish this sooner!
I'm not normally one for revenge, but this does feel a little nice.
Don't think I didn't notice you staring at me when it was my turn.
If there's anything I can do to help...er, no-I meant emotionally, not physically!
Yes, good job ~player~!
You're really going to do it in front of us?!
Rikku says men find me attractive, but I never really believed her.
I would turn around, but then everyone would see my cards.
Just don't look at me, okay?!
Focus on the game, Yuna, not on ~name~.
I thought for sure you would back out!
If Sin doesn't destroy us for this, then I suppose it really must be an Eternal Calm.
Sorry, I just needed to calm myself if we're both going to do this together.
It looks like we'll be sharing this chapter of our stories, ~name~.
At least I'm not the only one who lost!
Remember when you were staring at me while I had to touch myself? I do.
It's polite manners to let a lady go first, but this time I would have gladly let you go first.
My guardians would be really unhappy if they found out ~name~ did this in front of me.
Does anyone know who decided on the forfeit for this game?
I wonder if any of the previous High Summoners came here on their pilgrimages?
Maybe I should put a magical barrier up, just in case.
Trying to focus on the game is so hard when I know I could end up like ~name~.
D-did you just mouth my name, ~name~?!
I'll finally admit it...I may have had a fantasy about something like this once.
I wonder if Tidus would have...
Using a machina for pleasure with a stranger I just met...I'm a long way from the practices of Yevon.
I don't mean to insult your pride, but would you mind finishing this quickly...it's quite cold and I'd like my clothes back.
I think I'm ready to go home and take a nice long bath now.
Are you thinking about what I did earlier, ~name~?
It's not my specialty, but Lulu did teach me some black magic spells. You know, for things like dealing with cheaters.
Oh, that feeling reminds me of my own healing spells!
Ah! Don't get any on my clothes!
Allow me to restore your stamina, ~name~.
Now that's something I never expected to see when I left on my pilgrimage two years ago.
So it can get worse than exposing myself to strangers.
I'm not sure whether to be flattered or offended, honestly.
Putting a barrier up...just in case.
You know a gentleman is supposed to let the lady go first, ~name~.
Now you broke my concentration!
I guess it's my turn next.
Well, at least you were gentlemanly enough to let me finish first, ~name~.
Okay, just between us, I guess I did enjoy this game a little bit.
I guess neither one of us got the ending we were hoping for, huh?
Oh my, we're allowed to touch each other?
It's like fate itself has it out for Aoba!
This aeon doesn't look like he'd fit in at a temple.
I'm really glad none of my aeons acted like yours do, Lucy.
I'm not sure whether to be relieved or insulted that you're focusing on ~player~ instead of me, Revy.
Oh, is that some sort of machina?
I hope that isn't an eidolon crystal...that would be disrespectful.
I know I should feel happy I beat you, but I just can't take joy in someone else's suffering.
Do we really have to make ~name~ do this? I'm okay with just letting her walk away now.
I hope you don't hate me for beating you, ~name~.
Thank goodness I didn't lose that last round.
Focus Yuna, or you'll end up like ~name~.
I'm really very sorry, but I don't think I'm brave enough to do that yet!
Having you join me actually makes this a little bit easier.
I'm sorry, but Rikku only gave me one of these machina devices.
Don't worry, ~name~. We can do this if we have each other for support!
It actually wasn't as bad as I expected, so cheer up ~name~.
I'd let you borrow my machina...but I don't think that would be sanitary.
Just let me know if you want some magic to help calm your nerves, ~name~.
I understand too. It's hard to get privacy when you're on an airship too.
Um, should that be glowing?
I can see the appeal of water...there was this one time at Lake Macalania...but that's a story for another time!
Just for the record, my magic does NOT do that!
I've never used my magic for...pleasure before.
Don't worry Bernadetta, I won't let any harm come to you.
Oh-oh my! I've never seen an unsent do that.
Well, I guess us Yunas have to stick together!
A wrestling match in here seems like a good way for someone to get hurt. Guess it's a good thing I know healing magic.
Trust me, I hadn't done it in a long time with all my responsibilities, and I feel more relaxed than I have in months now.
I wonder if there's a magic spell for levitation...
Maybe I could ask Lulu if she knows any levitation spells when I get home.
Holding onto a knife while touching yourself seems incredibly risky.
Is that what I'll look like if I lose...am I really brave enough to do this?
You're really going to do it? I respect you honoring your word!
Let me know if there's any way I can ease your burden, ~name~.
I do feel a little guilty letting ~name~ do this so I don't have to.
Don't worry, I won't look!
This may be the strangest meeting I've ever had with someone, and I met a man from a long lost city once.
See, it's not as bad once you start.
Don't worry, I've got my magic in case anyone tries anything while we do this.
It's an honor to have you at my side, ~name~.
I became a summoner to try and end suffering so let me know if I can make this easier for you, ~name~.
Look on the bright side, at least you didn't have to go first.
Too bad neither of us will get the victory we were hoping for today.
Hmmm, I've never thought about trying that...but maybe later.
You don't have to be ashamed that you're enjoying the forfeit, L'Arachel.
Honestly, normally I just have to do it quietly and as quickly as possible because I'm constantly surrounded by people. It's rather frustrating.
M-more than once? I don't think I've ever...
I've been told I have an excellent singing voice. I could help you sing if you like, Florina.
I wonder if I could use my magic to summon another Yuna.
Oh you brought a machina to help too?
I wish we could let ~name~ have some privacy at least. Making her do that in front of us seems cruel.
I wonder what the people back in Spira would say if they knew the High Summoner was watching this kind of forfeit.
We did gamble on blitzball games occasionally, but usually the forfeit was just doing someone else's chores or something like that.
Watching ~name~ do that just makes me panic about having to join her if I lose.
I'm sorry this isn't much I can do to help you, ~name~.
Wait, why are you looking at me, ~name~?
Oh, I never thought of doing that before ~name~.
I've never seen another woman do this, so I guess it's a learning experience.
Thanks for doing this with me, ~name~. I owe you one.
On the bright side, we shouldn't have to wait too much longer to get our clothes back now.
I can't believe I looked like ~name~ just a bit ago.
Would you to like visit my airship, the Celsius, after this, ~name~?
Ugh, it's even more embarrassing thinking about what all of you saw me do, watching ~name~ do it now.
Oh, are toys not as good as your hands? Maybe that present Rikku gave me...er, nothing!
There's nothing to be ashamed of Lyralei, but I won't tell anyone if that is your wish.
You have nothing to be ashamed of, Lyralei, but I won't tell anyone if that is your wish.
Cheating was wrong, but it takes a strong person to admit their mistakes. I forgive you, Tomoko.
Oh my, there's a book about the Inventory? I hope it wasn't required reading before we came.
Was that some sort of magic, Caulifla?
Sorry, but only one Yuna can win today!
Are you an aeon?!
Maybe I haven't been using my magic creatively enough.
I'm glad you enjoyed yourself, Videl. No need to be embarrassed.
This is...unsettling.
Oh my! More than once...that's never happened to me before.
Um, how are you planning to get home without any clothing?
There was a boy I loved...his name was Tidus. I...miss him.
I can't believe...in front of...oh, oh, my.
If I lose, they'll all see me...gulp.
You poor thing, ~name~. Let me at least boost your stamina.
I absolutely HAVE to win the next round now!
I may be naked, but at least I haven't lost my dignity...yet.
At least it can't get any worse now, right ~name~?
Oh Sinspawn, they're all gonna see me do that.
I'm begging you, please don't look at me when I...finish.
I-I guess that means it's m-my turn.
If you need any support after doing that, I'm here for you.
Well that was certainly embarrassing for me when I did it, but at least we have each other.
How are you feeling, ~name~?
I really have to...touch myself...in front of all of you? A-alright, a summoner's word is her bond!
I learned to practice smiling when I'm sad. You just have to laugh. HA. HA. HA. HA.
I can't run from my fate.
I learned to practice smiling when I'm sad. You just have to laugh. HA. HA. HA. HA.
I never used machina before the Church of Yevon fell, but Rikku gave me a device she says Al Bhed women use for pleasure.
Slow and steady, Yuna. Don't think about them watching you.
T-this device Rikku gave me is REALLY making me happy we can use machina now.
I can't believe I'm really d-doing this while you all watch.
I barely have time to take care of myself with all of my duties as high summoner, so I should thank you all for letting me play this game.
Playing a game like this without any responsibilities to worry about is freeing. Rikku was right about me needing to relieve some stress.
No one back on Besaid would believe that I'm doing this...guess that's a good thing if any rumors about this spread.
T-t-they're all going to see!
A-almost there!
J-just like in the lake w-with him!
I-it's even better with an audience. What's wrong with me?
Yes, that's the spot!
TIDUS! YES!
Um, sorry about that. Tidus was a man...well, I was in love with him.
Stronger than you thought, huh?
Oh my, looks like we're all getting naked after all!
I was so close to winning too. Maybe next time.
Someday I will defeat sorrow.
Um, do you need some healing, Lyralei? That looked rather...painful.
Don't worry, I won't tell anyone about this game. I hope you'll extend me the same courtesy.
Oh my! Isn't that dangerous?
Do you need some healing magic after that, Lyralei? It looked...painful.
Oh, I'm so glad you found your glasses, Ignatz!
